instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00923 no display
threads.message:
The board draws 20V CPU gets warm too
liquid spill on the motherboard the affected area was U8510 and c7434,c7436,c7437 are corroded...
I replaced all components and no changes..
I took some readings around u8510 compared diode mode readings to good board found r8592 pin 2=BUF_SMC_RESET_L is 0.078 instead of 0.358..

Dont know how many volts passes the line now injected 0.9volts now found  U5000 heating...
Then i replaced u5000 board now draws 5V not coming up
Am sure i replaced it well..

threads.title: 820-00923 no display
threads.message:
Something else affected by heat.
Or the new SMC is bad.

Just in case, check diode mode to ground at EDP_INT lines of J8500.
Pay atention to pins 1 & 3.

threads.title: 820-00923 no display
threads.message:
Pin3=0.277
Pin1=0.003 from the processor i think 🤔

threads.title: 820-00923 no display
threads.message: The board i removed the SMC board was working

threads.title: 820-00923 no display
threads.message:
The CPU is fucked off; eDP output is damaged.
Don't waste more time with this board...
